analyzed: adhastāt jānvoḥ ā padbhyām

analyzed: śuśrūṣā anuvrajyā ca yāvadadhyayanam

analyzed: brahma vai mṛtyave prajāḥ prāyacchat
translated: Brahma indeed gave the creatures to Death.

analyzed: tasmai brahmacāriṇam eva na prāyacchat
translated: To him he did not give the Brahmacharin.

original: sasabravīd astu mahyam apy etasmin bhāga iti /

analyzed: yām eva rātrim samidham na āharātai iti

analyzed: tasmāt brahmacārī yām rātrim samidham na āharati āyuṣe eva tām avadāya vasati

analyzed: dīrgasattram vai eṣaḥ upaiti yaḥ brahmacaryam upaiti
translated: For one who undertakes the vow of studentship enters a long sacrificial session.

analyzed: sa yām upayan samidham ādadhāti sā prāyaṇīyā atha yām snāsyan sā audayanīyā atha yāḥ antareṇa sattryāḥ eva asya tāḥ
translated: The piece of firewood he puts on the fire when he begins is the opening oblation, the one he puts on when he is about to bathe is the concluding oblation, and those he puts on in between are the sessions of the sacrificial session.

original: brāhmaṇo vai brahmacaryam upayancaturdhā bhūtānipraviśaty agniṃ padā mṛtyuṃ padāācāryaṃ padāātmany evaasyacaturthaḥ pādaḥ
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ vai brahmacaryam upayan caturdhā bhūtāni praviśati agnim padā mṛtyum padā ācāryam padā ātmani eva asya caturthaḥ pādaḥ
translated: A Brahmin who undertakes the vow of studentship enters the beings in four ways: one foot into the fire, one foot into death, one foot into the teacher, and his fourth foot remains in himself.

analyzed: pariśiṣyate
translated: That which remains over.

original: sa yad agnau samidham ādadhāti ya evaasyaagnau pādas tameva tena parikrīṇāti taṃ saṃskṛtyaātman dhatte sa enam āviśati
analyzed: sa yat agnau samidham ādadhāti yaḥ eva asya agnau pādaḥ tam eva tena parikrīṇāti tam saṃskṛtya ātman dhatte saḥ enam āviśati
translated: When he puts a piece of firewood on the fire, he buys with that very foot of his that is in the fire, and having purified it, he places it in himself, and it enters him.

original: atha yad ātmānaṃ daridrī /krityaahrīr bhūtvā bhikṣatebrahmacaryaṃ
analyzed: atha yat ātmānam daridrīkritya ahrīḥ bhūtvā bhikṣate brahmacaryam
translated: Then when he makes himself poor, becomes shameless, and practices celibacy begging,

original: carati ya evaasya mṛtyau pādas tam eva tena parikrīṇātitaṃ saṃskṛtyaātman dhatte sa enam āviśati /
analyzed: carati yaḥ eva asya mṛtyau pādaḥ tam eva tena parikrīṇāti tam saṃskṛtya ātman dhatte saḥ enam āviśati
translated: he buys with that very foot of his that is in death, and having purified it, he places it in himself, and it enters him.

original: atha yad ācārya /vacaḥ karoti ya evaasyaācārye pādas tameva tena parikrīṇāti taṃ saṃskṛtyaātman dhatte sa enam āviśati
analyzed: atha yat ācārya vacaḥ karoti yaḥ eva asya ācārye pādaḥ tam eva tena parikrīṇāti tam saṃskṛtya ātman dhatte saḥ enam āviśati
translated: Now, when he does what his teacher tells him, he buys with that very foot of his which is in his teacher, he buys it, purifies it, and puts it into himself, and it enters him.

original: atha yat svādhyāyam adhīte ya evaasyaātmani pādas tameva tena parikrīṇāti taṃ saṃskṛtyaātman dhatte sa enam āviśati
analyzed: atha yat svādhyāyam adhīte yaḥ eva asya ātmani pādaḥ tam eva tena parikrīṇāti tam saṃskṛtya ātman dhatte saḥ enam āviśati
translated: And when he studies the Veda, he buys with that very foot of his which is in his self, he buys it, purifies it, and puts it into himself, and it enters him.

analyzed: na ha vai snātvā bhikṣeta
translated: One should not beg for alms after bathing.

original: api ha vai snātvā bhikṣāṃcaraty api jñātīnām aśanāyāapi pitqṇām anyābhyaḥ kriyābhyaḥ /
analyzed: api ha vai snātvā bhikṣām carati api jñātīnām aśanāyā api pitūnām anyābhyaḥ kriyābhyaḥ
translated: Even after bathing, one may go for alms, even for the sake of eating among one's relatives, even for the sake of one's ancestors, even for the sake of other rites.

original: sa yad anyāṃ bhikṣitavyāṃ na vindetaapi svāmevaācārya /jāyāṃ bhikṣetaatho svāṃ mātaram /
analyzed: sa yat anyām bhikṣitavyām na vindeta api svām eva ācārya jāyām bhikṣeta atha u svām mātaram
translated: If he finds no one else to beg from, he may beg from his own teacher's wife, or from his own mother.

analyzed: na enam saptamī abhikṣitā atīyāt
translated: He should not pass seven days without begging.

analyzed: bhaikṣasya a caraṇe doṣaḥ pāvakasya a samindhane
translated: There is a fault in not begging for alms, in not kindling the sacred fire.

analyzed: sapta rātram a kṛtvā etat avakīrṇi vratam caret
translated: For seven nights he should perform the Avakīrṇi penance without doing this.

original: tam evaṃ vidvāṃsam evaṃ carantaṃ sarve vedā āviśanti //
analyzed: tam evam vidvāṃsam evam carantam sarve vedāḥ āviśanti
translated: All the Vedas enter him who knows this and acts thus.

original: yathā ha vā agniḥ samiddho rocateevaṃ ha vaieṣa snātvārocate ya evaṃ vidvān brahmacaryaṃ caratiiti brāhmaṇam /
analyzed: yathā ha vai agniḥ samiddhaḥ rocate evam ha vai eṣa snātvā ārocate yaḥ evam vidvān brahmacaryam carati iti brāhmaṇam
translated: Just as a well-kindled fire shines, so does he who, knowing this, leads the life of a religious student, shine after bathing. Thus says the Brāhmaṇa.

analyzed: iti brāhmaṇam
translated: Thus says the Brāhmaṇa.

analyzed: atha snātakasya
translated: Now, of the Snātaka (the Graduate).

analyzed: antarvāsaḥ uttarīyam  vaiṇavam daṇḍam dhārayet
translated: The inner garment and the upper garment.🔽He should carry a staff made of bamboo.

analyzed: sa audakam ca kamaṇḍalum  dvi yajña upavītī
translated: And a water-pot with water.🔽Wearing the sacred thread over both shoulders.

original: uṣṇīṣam ajinam uttarīyam upānahau chattraṃ caupāsanaṃdarśapūrṇamāsau //
analyzed: uṣṇīṣam ajinam uttarīyam upānahau chattram ca aupāsanam darśapūrṇamāsau
translated: The turban, the antelope skin, the upper garment, the shoes, the umbrella, and the Darsha-Purnamāsa sacrifices.

analyzed: parvasu ca keśa śmaśru loma nakha vāpanam
translated: And on the Parva days, shaving the hair, beard, body hair, and nails.

analyzed: tasya vṛttiḥ
translated: His livelihood.

analyzed: brāhmaṇa rājanya vaiśya rathakāreṣu āmam lipseta
translated: He should seek raw food from Brahmins, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas, and Rathākaras.

analyzed: bhaikṣam vā
translated: Or alms.

analyzed: vāgyataḥ tiṣṭhet
translated: He should stand silently.

analyzed: sarvāṇi ca asya deva pitṛ saṃyuktāni pākayajña saṃsthāni bhūti karmāni kurvīta eti
translated: And he should perform all his rites connected with gods and ancestors, and all his rites for prosperity, in the manner of a Pākayajña (a domestic rite).

original: etena vidhinā prajāpateḥ parameṣṭhinaḥ parama /ṛṣayaḥ paramāṃkāṣṭhāṃ gacchantiiti baudhāyanaḥ //
analyzed: etena vidhinā prajāpateḥ parameṣṭhinaḥ parama ṛṣayaḥ paramām kāṣṭhām gacchanti iti baudhāyanaḥ
translated: By this method, the supreme sages attain the highest state of Prajāpati, the Supreme Lord. Thus says Baudhāyana.

analyzed: atha kamaṇḍalu caryām upadiśanti
translated: Now they teach the practice of the water-pot.

original: chāgasya dakṣiṇe karṇe pāṇau viprasya dakṣiṇe /
analyzed: chāgasya dakṣiṇe karṇe pāṇau viprasya dakṣiṇe
translated: In the right ear of a goat, in the right hand of a Brahmin,

analyzed: apsu ca eva kuśa stambe pāvakaḥ paripaṭhyate
translated: and in water and a bundle of Kusha grass, the sacred fire is recited.

original: tasmātśaucaṃ kṛtvā pāṇinā parimṛjīta paryagnikaraṇaṃ hitat /
analyzed: tasmāt śaucam kṛtvā pāṇinā parimṛjīta paryagnikaraṇam hi tat
translated: Therefore, having performed purification, one should wipe with the hand. This is the rite of paryanikaraṇa.

analyzed: uddīpyasva jātavedaḥ iti punar dāhāt viśiṣyate
translated: With the verse Blaze forth, O all-knower, it is superior to burning again.

original: tatraapi kiṃcit saṃspṛṣṭaṃ manasi manyeta K /
analyzed: tatra api kiṃcid saṃspṛṣṭam manasi manyeta kim
translated: There also, one should consider something touched in the mind.

original: manyate kuśairvā tṛṇair vā prajvālya pradakṣiṇaṃ paridahanam //
analyzed: manyate kuśaiḥ vā tṛṇaiḥ vā prajvālya pradakṣiṇam paridahanam
translated: Or one should consider it by kindling with Kusha grass or grass and burning it clockwise.

analyzed: atas ūrdhvam śva vāyasa prabhṛti upahatānām agni varṇaḥ iti upadiśanti  mūtra purīṣa lohitak
translated: From here onwards, they teach the rite for those defiled by dogs, crows, and so on, with the verse beginning with agnivarṇa.🔽For those defiled by urine, feces, blood,

analyzed: rohita retaḥ prabhṛti upahatānām utsargaḥ
translated: and semen, etc., there is the rite of disposal.

original: bhagne kamaṇḍalau vyāhṛtibhiḥ śataṃ juhuyāj japed vā //
analyzed: bhagne kamaṇḍalau vyāhṛtibhiḥ śatam juhuyāt japet vā
translated: If the water pot is broken, one should offer one hundred oblations with the Vyāhṛtis or recite them.

original: bhūmir bhūmim agān mātā mātaram apy agāt /
analyzed: bhūmiḥ bhūmim agāt mātā mātaram api agāt
translated: The earth has gone to the earth, the mother has gone to the mother.

original: bhūyāsmaputraiḥ paśubhir yo no dveṣṭi sa bhidyatām iti //
analyzed: bhūyāsma putraiḥ paśubhiḥ yaḥ naḥ dveṣṭi sa bhidyatām iti
translated: May we be with sons and cattle. Let him be split who hates us.🔽(The same as above)🔽(The same as above)

original: Asṣṣ / / / / / / ApṃP / / / cf / ṣadvBaudh / / / Kausṣṣ / / / Kausṣ /
analyzed: asṣ    apṃp  cf ṣadu baudh
translated: (The same as above)

original: kapālāni saṃhṛtyaapsu prakṣipya sāvitrīṃ daśa /avarāṃkṛtvā punar evaanyaṃ gṛhṇīyāt //
analyzed: kapālāni saṃhṛtya apsu prakṣipya sāvitrīm daśa avarām kṛtvā punar eva anyam gṛhṇīyāt
translated: having made a lower part, he should take up another.

analyzed: varuṇam āśritya
translated: Relying on Varuṇa.

original: etat te varuṇa punar eva mām om iti /
analyzed: etat te varuṇa punar eva mām om iti
translated: This, O Varuṇa, is yours again. Om.

analyzed: akṣaram dhyāyet
translated: He should meditate on the syllable.

original: śūdrād gṛhya śataṃ kuryād vaiśyād ardhaśataṃ smṛtam /
analyzed: śūdrāt gṛhya śatam kuryāt vaiśyāt ardhaśatam smṛtam
translated: If he takes it from a Śūdra, he should perform a hundred (penances); if from a Vaiśya, a hundred and fifty is prescribed;

original: kṣatriyāt pañcaviṃśat tu brāhmaṇād daśa kīrtitāḥ //
analyzed: kṣatriyāt pañcaviṃśat tu brāhmaṇāt daśa kīrtitāḥ
translated: if from a Kṣatriya, twenty-five; if from a Brāhmaṇa, ten are declared.

original: astam /ita āditya udakaṃ gṛhṇīyān na gṛhṇīyād itimīmāṃsante brahmavādinaḥ //
analyzed: astamite āditye udakam gṛhṇīyāt na gṛhṇīyāt iti mīmāṃsante brahma vādinaḥ
translated: When the sun has set, they discuss whether one should take water or not. The expounders of the Veda say:

analyzed: gṛhṇīyāt iti etat aparam
translated: One should take it. This is another view.

original: yāvad udakaṃ gṛhṇīyāt tāvat prāṇam K /
analyzed: yāvat udakam gṛhṇīyāt tāvat prāṇam k
translated: For as long as one takes water, for that long one should restrain the vital breath.

analyzed: prāṇān āyacchet
translated: One should control the vital breaths.

original: agnir ha vai hy udakaṃ gṛhṇāti //
analyzed: agniḥ ha vai hi udakam gṛhṇāti
translated: For Agni indeed takes water.

analyzed: kamaṇḍalu udakena abhiṣikta pāṇi pādaḥ yāvat ārdram tāvat aśuciḥ pareṣām
translated: One whose hands and feet are sprinkled with water from a water pot is impure for as long as it is wet for others.

analyzed: ātmānam eva pūtam karoti
translated: He makes himself pure.

analyzed: na anyat karma kurvīta eti vijñāyate
translated: It is understood that he should not perform any other rite.

original: api vā prati /śaucam ā maṇibandhātśucir iti baudhāyanaḥ //
analyzed: api vā pratiśaucam ā maṇibandhāt śuciḥ iti baudhāyanaḥ
translated: Or, according to Baudhāyana, up to the wrist one is pure.

analyzed: atha api udāharanti
translated: Now they quote:

analyzed: kamaṇḍaluḥ dvijātīnām śauca artham vihitaḥ purā
translated: The water pot was ordained in ancient times for the purification of twice-born people.

original: brahmaṇā muni /mukhyaiś ca tasmāt taṃ dhārayet sadā //
analyzed: brahmaṇā muni mukhyaiḥ ca tasmāt tam dhārayet sadā
translated: Brahma and the chief sages have said that one should always carry it.

original: tataḥ śaucaṃ tataḥ pānaṃ saṃdhyā /upāsanam eva ca /
analyzed: tatas śaucam tatas pānam saṃdhyā upāsanam eva ca
translated: Then purification, then drinking, then the worship of the evening twilight,

analyzed: nirviśaṅkena kartavyam yadi icchet śreyaḥ ātmanaḥ
translated: should be done without hesitation, if one desires one's own welfare.

original: kuryātśuddhena manasā na cittaṃ dūṣayed budhaḥ /
analyzed: kuryāt śuddhena manasā na cittam dūṣayet budhaḥ
translated: One should do it with a pure mind and not defile one's thoughts.

original: sahakamaṇḍalunāutpannaḥ svayaṃ /bhūs tasmāt kamaṇḍalunā caret ācaret//
analyzed: saha kamaṇḍalunā utpannaḥ svayaṃbhūḥ tasmāt kamaṇḍalunā caret ācaret
translated: The self-born one appeared with a water pot, therefore one should practice with a water pot.

original: mūtra /purīṣe kurvan dakṣiṇe haste gṛhṇāti savya ācamanīyam/
analyzed: mūtra purīṣe kurvan dakṣiṇe haste gṛhṇāti savye ācamanīyam
translated: While defecating or urinating, one holds it in the right hand, and the water for sipping in the left.

analyzed: etat sidhyati sādhūnām
translated: This is accomplished for the virtuous.

original: yathā hi soma /saṃyogāc camaso medhya ucyate /
analyzed: yathā hi soma saṃyogāt camasaḥ medhyaḥ ucyate
translated: Just as a vessel is said to be pure due to its contact with Soma,

original: apāṃ tathāeva saṃyogān nityo medhyaḥ kamaṇḍaluḥ //
analyzed: apām tathā eva saṃyogāt nityaḥ medhyaḥ kamaṇḍaluḥ
translated: in the same way, the water pot is always pure due to its contact with water.

analyzed: pitṛ deva agni kāryeṣu tasmāt tam parivarjayet
translated: Therefore, one should avoid it in the rites for the ancestors, gods, and fire.

original: tasmād vinā kamaṇḍalunā naadhvānaṃ vrajen na sīmantaṃ nagṛhād gṛham //
analyzed: tasmāt vinā kamaṇḍalunā na adhvānam vrajet na sīmantam na gṛhāt gṛham
translated: Therefore, one should not travel on the road without a water pot, nor from house to house, nor to the parting of the hair.

original: padam api na gacched iṣu /mātrād ity eke //
analyzed: padam api na gacchet iṣu mātrāt iti eke
translated: Some say one should not go even a step beyond the distance of an arrow.

analyzed: yat icchet dharma saṃtatim iti baudhāyanaḥ
translated: If he wishes for a continuation of the Dharma, says Baudhāyana.

analyzed: ṛk vidhena eti vāc vadati  ṛk vidhena eti vāc vadati
translated: With the method of the Ṛg Veda, speech speaks.🔽 With the method of the Ṛg Veda, speech speaks.

original: K /ṛgvidham ṛgvidhānaṃ vāg vadati ṛgvidham ṛgvidhānaṃ vāg vadati //
analyzed: kṛc vidham ṛc vidhānam vāc vadati ṛc vidham ṛc vidhānam vāc vadati
translated: The method of the Ṛg Veda, the arrangement of the Ṛg Veda, speech speaks. The method of the Ṛg Veda, the arrangement of the Ṛg Veda, speech speaks.

analyzed: atha atas śauca adhiṣṭhānam
translated: Now, therefore, the basis of purity.

original: adbhiḥ śudhyanti gātrāṇi buddhir jñānena śudhyati /
analyzed: adbhiḥ śudhyanti gātrāṇi buddhiḥ jñānena śudhyati
translated: The body is purified by water, the mind by knowledge,

original: ahiṃsayā ca bhūtātmā manaḥ satyena śudhyati // iti //
analyzed: ahiṃsayā ca bhūtātmā manaḥ satyena śudhyati iti
translated: and the soul by non-violence, the mind is purified by truth.
The purification of the mind is inner purity.

analyzed: bahiḥśaucam vyākhyāsyāmaḥ
translated: We will explain outer purity.

analyzed: kauśam sautram vā tris trivṛt yajñopavītam
translated: The sacred thread is made of silk or cotton, triple, triple-twisted.

analyzed: ā nābheḥ
translated: Up to the navel.

original: dakṣiṇaṃ bāhum uddhṛtya savyam avadhāya śirasavadadhyāt //
analyzed: dakṣiṇam bāhum uddhṛtya savyam avadhāya śirasā avadadhyāt
translated: Having raised the right arm and lowered the left, one should place it on the head.

analyzed: viparītam pitṛbhyaḥ  kaṇṭhe avasaktam nivītam
translated: The opposite for the ancestors.🔽The sacred thread worn over the neck is called nivīta.

analyzed: adhasavasaktam adhas vītam
translated: The sacred thread worn under the armpit is called adhhovīta.

original: prāṅ /mukha udaṅ /mukho vāāsīnaḥ śaucam ārabheta śucau deśedakṣiṇam bāhuṃ jānu /antarā kṛtvā prakṣālya pādau pāṇī caāmaṇibandhāt
analyzed: prāc mukhaḥ udak mukhaḥ vā āsīnaḥ śaucam ārabheta śucau deśe dakṣiṇam bāhum jānu antarā kṛtvā prakṣālya pādau pāṇī ca ā maṇibandhāt
translated: Facing east or north, one should begin the purification in a clean place, placing the right arm between the knees, and washing the feet and hands up to the wrists.

analyzed: pāda prakṣālana auccheṣaṇena na ācāmet
translated: He should not sip water with the water left over from washing his feet.

analyzed: yadi ācāmet bhūmau srāvayitvā ācāmet
translated: If he does sip it, he should do so after letting it flow on the ground.

analyzed: brāhmeṇa tīrthena ācāmet
translated: He should sip water with the Brahmic way of sipping.

analyzed: aṅguṣṭha mūlam brāhmam tīrtham
translated: The root of the thumb is the Brahmic way of sipping.

original: aṅguṣṭha /agraṃ pitryam aṅguly /agraṃ daivam aṅguli /mūlam ārṣam //
analyzed: aṅguṣṭha agram pitryam aṅguli agram daivam aṅguli mūlam ārṣam
translated: The tip of the thumb is the way of the ancestors, the tip of the fingers is the way of the gods, and the root of the fingers is the way of the sages.

original: naaṅgulībhir na sa /budbudābhir na sa /phenābhir nauṣṇābhirna kṣārābhir na lavaṇābhir na kaluṣābhir na vivarṇābhir nadur /gandha /rasābhiḥ
analyzed: na aṅgulībhiḥ na sa budbudābhiḥ na sa phenābhiḥ na uṣṇābhiḥ na kṣārābhiḥ na lavaṇābhiḥ na kaluṣābhiḥ na vivarṇābhiḥ na durgandha rasābhiḥ
translated: He should not sip with his fingers, nor with bubbles, nor with foam, nor with hot water, nor with saline water, nor with salty water, nor with turbid water, nor with discolored water, nor with water having an unpleasant smell or taste.

original: na hasan na jalpan na tiṣṭhan na vilokayan na prahvo na praṇatona🔽mukta /śikho na prāvṛta /kaṇṭho na veṣṭita /śirā na tvaramāṇonaayajñopavītī na prasārita /pādo
analyzed: na hasan na jalpan na tiṣṭhan na vilokayan na prahvaḥ na praṇataḥ na  mukta śikhaḥ na prāvṛta kaṇṭhaḥ na veṣṭita śirāḥ na tvaramāṇaḥ na a yajña upavītī na prasārita pādaḥ
translated: He should not sip while laughing, talking, standing, looking around, bending down, bowing,🔽with his hair loose, with his neck covered, with his head wrapped, in a hurry, without his sacred thread, with his feet stretched out,

original: na baddha /kakṣyo na bahir /jānuḥśabdam akurvan //🔽trir apo hṛdayaṃ /gamāḥ pibet //
analyzed: na baddha kakṣyaḥ na bahis jānuḥ śabdam akurvan  tris apaḥ hṛdayaṃgamāḥ pibet
translated: with his belt tied, or with his knees drawn up to his chest, making a sound.🔽He should drink water three times, letting it reach his heart.

analyzed: tris parimṛjet
translated: He should wipe his lips three times.

analyzed: dvis iti eke
translated: Some say twice.

analyzed: sakṛt ubhayam śūdrasya striyāḥ ca
translated: Once for both in the case of a Shudra and a woman.

analyzed: atha api udāharanti
translated: Now they also quote:

original: gatābhir hṛdayaṃ vipraḥ kaṇṭhyābhiḥ kṣatriyaḥ śuciḥ /
analyzed: gatābhiḥ hṛdayam vipraḥ kaṇṭhyābhiḥ kṣatriyaḥ śuciḥ
translated: A Brahmin becomes pure by (sipping) water that has reached the heart, a Kshatriya by (sipping) water that has reached the throat,

original: vaiśyasadbhiḥ prāśitābhiḥ syāt strī /śūdrau spṛśyacaantataḥ // iti //
analyzed: vaiśya sadbhiḥ prāśitābhiḥ syāt strī śūdrau iti
translated: a Vaisya by (sipping) water that has reached the palate, and a woman or a Sudra by (sipping) water that has reached the lips at the end.

analyzed: danta vat danta sakteṣu danta vat teṣu dhāraṇāt
translated: Like teeth, in the case of things sticking to the teeth, because of holding them like teeth.

original: srasteṣu teṣu naācāmet teṣāṃ saṃsrāvavatśuciḥ // iti //
analyzed: srasteṣu teṣu na ācāmet teṣām saṃsrāvavat śuciḥ iti
translated: When they are loosened, he should not sip water, being pure like their discharge.

analyzed: atha api udāharanti
translated: Now they also quote:

original: dantavad danta /lagneṣu yac caapy antar mukhe bhavet /
analyzed: danta vat danta lagneṣu yat ca api antar mukhe bhavet
translated: Like teeth, in the case of things sticking to the teeth, and whatever may be in the mouth,

original: ācāntasyaavaśiṣṭaṃ syān nigirann eva tatśuciḥ // iti //
analyzed: ācāntasya avaśiṣṭam syāt nigiran eva tat śuciḥ iti
translated: would be left over for one who has sipped water, and he is pure by just swallowing it.

original: khāny adbhiḥ saṃspṛśya pādau nābhiṃ śiraḥ savyaṃ pāṇimantataḥ //🔽taijasaṃ ced ādāyaucchiṣṭī syāt tadudasyaācamyaādāsyann adbhiḥ prokṣet //🔽atha ced annenaucchiṣṭī syāt tad udasyaācamyaādāsyannadbhiḥ prokṣet //
analyzed: khāni adbhiḥ saṃspṛśya pādau nābhim śiraḥ savyam pāṇimantataḥ  taijasam ced ādāya aucchiṣṭī syāt tat udasya ācamya ādāsyan adbhiḥ prokṣet  atha ced annena aucchiṣṭī syāt tat udasya ācamya ādāsyan adbhiḥ prokṣet
translated: Having touched the cavities with water, the feet, the navel, the head, and the right hand at the end.🔽If it is made of metal, he should become pure by throwing it away, sipping water, and sprinkling it with water while taking it again.🔽If he becomes impure with food, he should become pure by throwing it away, sipping water, and sprinkling it with water while taking it again.

original: atha ced adbhir ucchiṣṭī syāt tad udasyaācamyaādāsyannadbhiḥ prokṣet //
analyzed: atha ced adbhiḥ ucchiṣṭī syāt tat udasya ācamya ādāsyan adbhiḥ prokṣet
translated: If he becomes impure with water, he should become pure by throwing it away, sipping water, and sprinkling it with water while taking it again.

analyzed: etat eva viparītam amatre
translated: This very (rule) is reversed in the case of a vessel.

analyzed: vānaspatye vikalpaḥ
translated: In the case of one made of wood, there is an option.

analyzed: taijasānām ucchiṣṭānām go śakṛt mṛd bhasmabhiḥ parimārjanam anyatamena vā
translated: For metallic objects that have become impure, they should be wiped with cow dung, clay, or ashes, or with any one of them.

analyzed: tāmra rajata suvarṇānām amlaiḥ  amatrāṇām dahanam
translated: For copper, silver, and gold objects, with sour substances.🔽For measuring vessels, burning.

analyzed: dāravāṇām takṣaṇam  vaiṇavānām gomayena
translated: For wooden objects, cutting.🔽For bamboo objects, with cow dung.

analyzed: phala mayānām go vāla rajjvā
translated: For objects made of fruit, with a rope of cow's hair.🔽For black antelope skins, with bilva rice.

analyzed: kṛṣṇa ajinānām bilva taṇḍulaiḥ  kutapānām ariṣṭaiḥ  aurṇānām ādityena
translated: For woolen cloth, with arishta plants.🔽For woolen cloth, with the sun.

analyzed: kṣaumāṇām gaurasarṣapa kalkena  mṛdā celānām  cela vat carmaṇām
translated: For linen cloth, with a paste of white mustard seeds.🔽For cotton cloth, with clay.🔽For leather objects, like cotton cloth.

analyzed: taijasa vat upala maṇīnām  dāru vat asthnām
translated: For stone and gem objects, like metallic objects.🔽For bone objects, like wood.

analyzed: kṣauma vat śaṅkha śṛṅga śukti dantānām
translated: For conch shells, horns, shells, and teeth, like linen cloth.

analyzed: payasā vā
translated: Or with milk.

analyzed: cakṣuḥ ghrāṇa ānukūlyāt vā a mūtra purīṣa asṛj śukra kuṇapa spṛṣṭānām pūrva uktānām anyatamena tris sapta kṛtvas parimārjanam
translated: For objects that have come in contact with urine, feces, blood, semen, or corpses, which are of the same nature as the above, they should be wiped three or seven times with any one of the above substances, according to their suitability to the eye or nose.

analyzed: a taijasānām evaṃbhūtānām utsargaḥ
translated: For objects that are not metallic but of the same nature, they should be discarded.

analyzed: vacanāt yajñe camasa pātrānām
translated: By the statement, for sacrificial vessels at a sacrifice.

analyzed: na somena eva ucchiṣṭāḥ bhavanti iti śrutiḥ
translated: The Vedic text says that they do not become impure with Soma.
The fire of time is the purification of the mind, water is the first unguent,

original: avijñātaṃ ca bhūtāṇāṃ ṣaḍvidhaṃ śaucam ucyate // iti //
analyzed: a vijñātam ca bhūtāṇām ṣaḍvidham śaucam ucyate iti
translated: and the sixfold purification of beings is said to be unknown.

analyzed: atha api udāharanti
translated: Now they also quote:

analyzed: kālam deśam tathā ātmānam dravyam dravya prayojanam
translated: Time, place, oneself, substance, purpose of the substance,

analyzed: upapattim avasthām ca vijñāya śaucam śauca jñaḥ kuśalaḥ dharma īpsuḥ samācaret
translated: reasoning, and condition - having understood these, one who knows purity, is skilled, and desires dharma, should practice.

analyzed: nityam śuddhaḥ kāru hastaḥ paṇyam yat ca prasāritam
translated: The hand of a barber is always pure, and goods that are displayed,

analyzed: brahmacāri gatam bhaikṣam nityam medhyam iti śrutiḥ

analyzed: vatsaḥ prasnavane medhyaḥ śakuniḥ phala śātane
translated: A calf is pure at the udder, a bird at tearing fruit,

original: striyaś ca rati /saṃsarge śvā mṛga /grahaṇe śuciḥ //
analyzed: striyaḥ ca rati saṃsarge śvā mṛga grahaṇe śuciḥ
translated: and women are pure in sexual intercourse, and a dog is pure in catching game.

analyzed: ākarāḥ śucayaḥ sarve varjayitvā surā ākaram
translated: All mines are pure, except those of alcohol,

analyzed: a dūṣyāḥ saṃtatāḥ dhārāḥ vāta audbhūtāḥ ca reṇavaḥ  amedhyeṣu ca ye vṛkṣāḥ uptāḥ puṣpa phala aupagāḥ
translated: and continuous streams that are not polluted, and dust particles blown by the wind.🔽And those trees that are planted among impure things, and bear flowers and fruits,

analyzed: teṣām api na duṣyanti puṣpāṇi ca phalāni ca

analyzed: caitya vṛkṣam citim yūpam caṇḍālam veda vikrayam
translated: A caitya, a tree, an altar, a sacrificial post, an outcaste, the Veda, and selling—

analyzed: etāni brāhmaṇaḥ spṛṣṭvā sa celaḥ jalam āviśet
translated: having touched these, a Brahmin should enter water with his clothes on.

analyzed: ātma śayyā āsanam vastram jāyā apatyam kamaṇḍaluḥ
translated: A bed, seat, garment, wife, children, and water pot—

original: śucīny ātmana etāni pareṣām aśucīni tu //
analyzed: śucīni ātmanaḥ etāni pareṣām aśucīni tu
translated: these are pure for oneself, but impure for others.

analyzed: āsanam śayanam yānam nāvaḥ pathi tṛṇāni ca
translated: A seat, bed, vehicle, boat, grass on the road,

original: caṇḍāla /patita /spṛṣṭaṃ mārutenaeva śudhyati //🔽khalakṣetreṣu yad dhānyaṃ kūpa /vāpīṣu yaj jalam /
analyzed: caṇḍāla patita spṛṣṭam mārutena eva śudhyati  khala kṣetreṣu yat dhānyam kūpa vāpīṣu yat jalam
translated: and what is touched by an outcaste or fallen person become pure by wind alone.🔽The grain in a field ploughed by an outcaste, the water in wells and tanks,

analyzed: abhojyāt api tat bhojyam yat ca goṣṭha gatam payaḥ

analyzed: trīṇi devāḥ pavitrāṇi brāhmaṇānām akalpayan

analyzed: a dṛṣṭam adbhiḥ nirṇiktam yat ca vācā praśasyate
translated: what is not seen, what is washed with water, and what is praised with speech.

original: āpaḥ pavitraṃ bhūmi /gatā go /tṛptir yāsu jāyate /
analyzed: āpaḥ pavitram bhūmi gatāḥ go tṛptiḥ yāsu jāyate
translated: Water is pure when it reaches the ground and satisfies cows,

analyzed: a vyāptāḥ ced amedhyena gandha varṇa rasa anvitāḥ
translated: if it is not pervaded by impure substances, and possesses smell, color, and taste.

analyzed: bhūmeḥ tu saṃmārjana prokṣaṇa aupalepana avastaraṇa aullekhanaiḥ yathāsthānam doṣa viśeṣāt prāyatyam
translated: The ground becomes pure by sweeping, sprinkling, smearing, spreading grass, or scraping, as appropriate, due to the specific impurity.

analyzed: atha api udāharanti

analyzed: gocarma mātram ap binduḥ bhūmeḥ śudhyati pātitaḥ

analyzed: samūḍham a samūḍham vā yatra amedhyam na lakṣyate iti

analyzed: parokṣam adhiśritasya annasya avadyotya abhyukṣaṇam
translated: For food that is placed out of sight, sprinkling is prescribed.

analyzed: tathā āāpaṇeyānām ca bhakṣāṇām
translated: And for edible things that are sold in the market.

analyzed: bībhatsavaḥ śuci kāmāḥ hi devāḥ na a śraddadhānasya haviḥ juṣante iti

analyzed: śuceḥ a śraddadhānasya śraddadhānasya ca aśuceḥ

analyzed: hatam a śraddadhānasya śraddhā pūtam viśiṣyate iti

analyzed: atha api udāharanti
translated: Now they also quote:

analyzed: tasmāt aśraddhayā dattam haviḥ na aśnanti devatāḥ

analyzed: iṣṭvā dattvā api vā mūrkhaḥ svargam nahi sa gacchati

analyzed: śaṅkā vihata cāritraḥ yaḥ sva abhiprāyam āśritaḥ
translated: Doubt. One who has violated his character and relies on his own opinion,

analyzed: śāstra atigaḥ smṛtaḥ mūrkhaḥ dharma tantra auparodhanāt iti
translated: is considered foolish by transgressing the scriptures, due to obstructing the system of Dharma.

analyzed: śāka puṣpa phala mūla oṣadhīnām tu prakṣālanam

analyzed: mūtre mṛdā adbhiḥ prakṣālanam
translated: In urine, there should be washing with earth and water.

analyzed: tris pāṇeḥ
translated: Three times with the hand.

analyzed: tadvat purīṣe
translated: Similarly, in feces.

original: paryāyāt tris triḥ pāyoḥ pāṇeś ca //
analyzed: paryāyāt tris tris pāyoḥ pāṇeḥ ca
translated: By turns, three times with the mouth and the hand.

original: mūtra /vad retasa utsarge //🔽nīvīṃ visrasya paridhāyaapa upaspṛśet //
analyzed: mūtra vat retasaḥ utsarge  nīvīm visrasya paridhāya apaḥ upaspṛśet

analyzed: ārdram tṛṇam gomayam bhūmim vā samupaspṛśet

analyzed: nābheḥ adhas sparśanam karma yuktaḥ varjayet

analyzed: ūrdhvam vai puruṣasya nābhyai medhyam avācīnam amedhyam iti śrutiḥ

analyzed: śūdrāṇām ārya adhiṣṭhitānām ardha māsi māsi vā vapanam ārya vat ācamana kalpaḥ
translated: For Shudras under the supervision of Aryas, shaving every half month or month, and the rules for sipping water are like those of Aryas.

analyzed: vaiśyaḥ kusīdam upajīvet
translated: A Vaisya may live by moneylending.

analyzed: pañcaviṃśatiḥ tu eva pañca māṣikī syāt
translated: But the rate of interest shall be only five in the hundred.

analyzed: atha api udāharanti
translated: Moreover, they quote:

analyzed: yaḥ samargham ṛṇam gṛhya mahāargham saṃprayojayet
translated: He who, having taken a loan at a low rate of interest, invests it at a high rate of interest,

analyzed: sa vai vārddhuṣikaḥ nāma sarva dharmeṣu garhitaḥ  vṛddhim ca bhrūṇa hatyām ca tulayā samatolayat
translated: is called a moneylender, and is despised by all virtuous men.🔽He weighed the interest and the killing of a foetus in a balance,

analyzed: atiṣṭhat bhrūṇa hā koṭyām vārddhuṣiḥ samakampata iti
translated: and the killer of a foetus remained on one side, while the moneylender trembled on the other.

analyzed: gorakṣakān vāṇijakān tathā kāru kuśīlavān
translated: Cowherds, traders, artisans, actors,

analyzed: preṣyān vārddhuṣikān ca eva viprān śūdra vat ācaret
translated: servants, and moneylenders, if they are Brahmins, should be treated like Sudras.

original: kāmaṃ tu parilupta /kṛtyāya kadaryāya nāstikāya pāpīyasepūrvau dadyātām //
analyzed: kāmam tu parilupta kṛtyāya kadaryāya nāstikāya pāpīyasepūrvau dadyātām
translated: But if they are unwilling to perform their duties, are miserly, unbelieving, sinful, and of low birth, then the two (parties) may give (the interest) to them.

analyzed: a yajñena a vivāhena vedasya autsādanena ca
translated: By not performing sacrifices, by not marrying, by neglecting the Veda,

analyzed: kulāni akula tām yānti brāhmaṇa atikrameṇa ca
translated: and by transgressing the duties of a Brahmin, families become non-Aryan.

analyzed: brāhmaṇa atikramaḥ na asti mūrkhe mantra vivarjite
translated: There is no transgression of the duties of a Brahmin in a fool devoid of mantras,

original: jvalantam agnim utsṛjya nahi bhasmani hūyate //
analyzed: jvalantam agnim utsṛjya nahi bhasmani hūyate
translated: for one does not offer oblations into ashes, abandoning a blazing fire.

original: gobhir aśvaiś ca yānaiś ca kṛṣyā rāja /upasevayā /🔽kulāny akulatāṃ yānti yāni hīnāni mantrataḥ //
analyzed: gobhiḥ aśvaiḥ ca yānaiḥ ca kṛṣyā rāja aupasevayā  kulāni akula tām yānti yāni hīnāni mantrataḥ
translated: By cattle, horses, vehicles, agriculture, and service to the king,🔽families that are inferior in terms of mantras go to the state of being non-families.

original: mantratas tu samṛddhāni kulāny alpa /dhanāny api /
analyzed: mantrataḥ tu samṛddhāni kulāni alpa dhanāni api
translated: But families that are prosperous in terms of mantras, even if they have little wealth,

original: kula /saṃkhyāṃ ca gacchanti karṣanti ca mahad /yaśaḥ //
analyzed: kula saṃkhyām ca gacchanti karṣanti ca mahat yaśaḥ
translated: attain the status of families and earn great fame.

analyzed: vedaḥ kṛṣi vināśāya kṛṣiḥ veda vināśinī
translated: The Vedas are for the destruction of agriculture, and agriculture is for the destruction of the Vedas.

original: śaktimān ubhayaṃ kuryād aśaktas tu kṛṣiṃ tyajet //
analyzed: śaktimān ubhayam kuryāt aśaktaḥ tu kṛṣim tyajet
translated: One who is able should do both, but one who is unable should abandon agriculture.

original: na vai devān pīvarasa /saṃyata /ātmā rorūyamāṇaḥ kakudīsamaśnute /
analyzed: na vai devān pīvarasa saṃyata ātmā rorūyamāṇaḥ kakudīsam aśnute
translated: One who is fat, restrained in mind, and has a dewlap does not enjoy the offerings to the gods while crying.

original: calat /tundī rabhasaḥ kama /vādī kṛśāsa ity aṇavas tatrayānti //
analyzed: calat tundī rabhasaḥ kama vādī kṛśāsaḥ iti aṇavaḥ tatra yānti
translated: One who has a moving dewlap, is impetuous, speaks like a goat, and is thin, such a one goes there as an atom.

original: yad yauvane carati vibhrameṇa sad vāasad vā yādṛśaṃ vāyadā vā /
analyzed: yat yauvane carati vibhrameṇa sat vā a asat vā yādṛśam vā a yadā vā
translated: Whatever one does in youth out of delusion, whether good or bad, in whatever way or at whatever time,

original: uttare ced vayasi sādhu /vṛttas tad evaasya bhavatinaitarāṇi //
analyzed: uttare ced vayasi sādhu vṛttaḥ tat eva asya
translated: if one is virtuous in the later stage of life, that alone becomes his, not the others.

analyzed: śoceta manasā nityam duṣkṛtāni anucintayan
translated: One should always grieve in one's mind, reflecting on one's misdeeds.

original: tapasvī caapramādī ca tataḥ pāpāt pramucyate //
analyzed: tapasvī ca apramādī ca tatas pāpāt pramucyate
translated: One who is an ascetic and heedful is thereby freed from sin.

original: spṛśanti bindavaḥ pādau ya ācāmayataḥ parān /
analyzed: spṛśanti bindavaḥ pādau ye ācāmayataḥ parān
translated: The drops that touch one's feet while one makes others sip water,

original: na tair ucchiṣṭa /bhāvaḥ syāt tulyās te bhūmi /gaiḥ saha// iti //
analyzed: na taiḥ ucchiṣṭa bhāvaḥ syāt tulyāḥ te bhūmi gaiḥ saha iti
translated: They are not rendered impure by the leavings of those (relations), for they are equal to the earth.

original: sapiṇḍeṣv ā daśa /aham āśaucam iti janana /maraṇayor adhikṛtyavadanty ṛtvig /dīkṣita /brahmacāri /varjam //
analyzed: sapiṇḍeṣu ā daśa aham āśaucam iti janana maraṇayoḥ adhikṛtya vadanti ṛtvij dīkṣita brahmacāri varjam
translated: As regards the Sapindas, they declare that the impurity lasts for ten days, with reference to birth and death, except in the case of the officiating priest, the initiated, the religious student, and the consecrated.

analyzed: sapiṇḍa tā tu ā saptamāt sapiṇḍeṣu
translated: The Sapinda-relationship (lasts) as long as the (Sapindas are) related by an unbroken line of seven ancestors.

original: ā sapta /māsād ā danta /jananād vāudaka /upasparśanam //🔽piṇḍa /udaka /kriyā prete naatrivarṣe vidhīyate /
analyzed: ā sapta māsāt ā danta jananāt vā audaka aupasparśanam  piṇḍa audaka kriyā prete na a tri varṣe vidhīyate
translated: The pouring of water (in honour of the deceased) is (performed) for seven months, or until the appearance of the teeth.

original: ā danta /jananād vāapi dahanaṃ ca na kārayet //
analyzed: ā danta jananāt vā api dahanam ca na kārayet
translated: The performance of the Pindas and the pouring of water (in honour of the deceased) is prescribed (to be performed) for three years, but not (if the deceased was) a child that had not passed the first birthday.🔽Nor is the cremation (to be performed) until the appearance of the teeth.

analyzed: aprattāsu ca kanyāsu
translated: And (the same rule holds good) in the case of unmarried girls.

analyzed: prattāsu eke ha kurvate
translated: Some (perform the Sraddha) in the case of married (girls).

original: loka /saṃgrahaṇa /arthaṃ hi tad amantrāḥ striyo matāḥ //
analyzed: loka saṃgrahaṇa artham hi tat amantrāḥ striyaḥ matāḥ
translated: For the sake of the approval of the people, women are considered to be without Mantras.

analyzed: strīṇām a kṛta vivāhānām tri ahāt śudhyanti bāndhavāḥ
translated: The relatives of women who have not been married become pure after three days.

original: yathāuktenaeva kalpena śudhyanti ca sanābhaya iti //
analyzed: yathā uktena eva kalpena śudhyanti ca sanābhayaḥ iti
translated: And the Sapindas become pure according to the rule stated above.

original: api ca prapitāmahaḥ pitāmahaḥ pitā svayaṃ sodaryā bhrātaraḥsavarṇāyāḥ
analyzed: api ca prapitāmahaḥ pitāmahaḥ pitā svayam sodaryāḥ bhrātaraḥ savarṇāyāḥ
translated: Moreover, the great-great-grandfather, the great-grandfather, the father, oneself, the uterine brothers, the brothers of the same caste,

original: putraḥ pautraḥ prapautras tat /putra /varjaṃ teṣāṃ caputra /pautram avibhakta /dāyam
analyzed: putraḥ pautraḥ prapautraḥ tad putra varjam teṣām ca putra pautram avibhakta dāyam
translated: A son, a grandson, a great-grandson, and so on. Except for the son, their sons and grandsons, whose inheritance is undivided,

analyzed: sapiṇḍān ācakṣate
translated: are called sapindas.

analyzed: vibhakta dāyān api sakulyān ācakṣate
translated: Even those whose inheritance is divided, if they belong to the same family, are called relatives.

original: asatsv anyeṣu tad /gāmī hy artho bhavati //
analyzed: a satsu anyeṣu tad gāmī hi arthaḥ bhavati
translated: For if the others are not present, the property goes to them.

analyzed: sapiṇḍa abhāve sakulyaḥ
translated: In the absence of sapindas, a relative.

analyzed: tad abhāve pitā ācāryaḥ antevāsī ṛtvij vā haret
translated: In the absence of that, a father, a teacher, a pupil, or a priest should take it.

analyzed: tad abhāve rājā tad svam k
translated: In the absence of that, the king should take that property.

analyzed: sat svam traividya vṛddhebhyaḥ saṃprayacchet
translated: But he should give it to the learned Brahmanas.

original: na tv eva kadā cit svayaṃ rājā brāhmaṇa /svam ādadīta //
analyzed: na tu eva kadā cit svayam rājā brāhmaṇa svam ādadīta
translated: But the king should never himself take the property of a Brahmana.

analyzed: atha api udāharanti
translated: Now they also quote:

analyzed: brahma svam putra pautra ghnam viṣam ekākinam haret
translated: Brahmana's property kills sons and grandsons, like poison for a solitary person.

original: na viṣaṃ viṣam ity āhur brahma /svaṃ viṣam ucyate //
analyzed: na viṣam viṣam iti āhuḥ brahma svam viṣam ucyate
translated: They do not call poison poison, but Brahmana's property is called poison.

analyzed: tasmāt rājā brāhmaṇa svam na ādadīta
translated: Therefore, the king should not take the property of a Brahmana.

original: paramaṃ hy etadviṣaṃ yad brāhmaṇa /svam iti //
analyzed: paramam hi etat viṣam yat brāhmaṇa svam iti
translated: For this is the highest poison, that is, the property of a Brahmana.

analyzed: janana maraṇayoḥ saṃnipāte samānaḥ daśarātraḥ
translated: When birth and death occur together, the impurity lasts for ten days.

original: atha yadi daśa /rātrāḥ saṃnipateyur ādyaṃ daśa /rātramāśaucam ā navamād divasāt //
analyzed: atha yadi daśarātrāḥ saṃnipateyuḥ ādyam daśa rātram āśaucam ā navamāt divasāt
translated: If ten days should coincide, then the impurity lasts for the first ten days until the ninth day.

analyzed: janane tāvat mātā pitroḥ daśa aham āśaucam
translated: In the case of birth, the impurity of the mother and father lasts for ten days.

analyzed: mātuḥ iti eke tad pariharaṇāt
translated: Some say it is only for the mother, because she carries him.

analyzed: pituḥ iti apare śukra prādhānyāt
translated: Others say it is for the father, because the semen is primary.

analyzed: a yoni jāḥ hi api putrāḥ śrūyante
translated: For sons born without a womb are heard of.

analyzed: mātā pitroḥ eva tu saṃsarga sāmānyāt
translated: But it is only for the mother and father, because they are the common source of the mixture.

original: maraṇe tu yathā /bālaṃ puraskṛtya yajñopavītāny apasavyānikṛtvā
analyzed: maraṇe tu yathābālam puraskṛtya yajñopavītāni apasavyāni kṛtvā
translated: But in the case of death, as for the child, having placed him in front, having turned the sacred thread to the left,

original: tīrtham avatīrya sakṛt sakṛt trir nimajjyaunmajjyauttīryaācamya tat /pratyayam
analyzed: tīrtham avatīrya sakṛt sakṛt tris nimajjya a unmajjya a uttīrya ācamya tad pratyayam
translated: having entered the water, having submerged and emerged three times each, having come out, having sipped water, having sprinkled that water,

original: udakam āsicyaata evauttīryaācamya gṛha /dvāryaṅgāram udkam iti saṃspṛśyaa /kṣāra /lavaṇa /āśino
analyzed: udakam āsicya atas eva uttīrya ācamya gṛha dvāri aṅgāram udkam iti saṃspṛśya a kṣāra lavaṇa āśinaḥ
translated: having come out of the water, having sipped water, having touched the charcoal and water at the door of the house, not eating anything that is alkaline or salty,

analyzed: daśa aham kaṭam āsīran
translated: they should sleep on the floor for ten days.

analyzed: ekādaśyām dvādaśyām vā śrāddha karma
translated: On the eleventh or twelfth day, the śrāddha rite.

analyzed: śeṣa kriyāyām
translated: In the remaining rites, one should follow the customs of the people.

analyzed: atra api asapiṇḍeṣu yathāāsannam tri rātram ahar rātram eka aham iti kurvīta

analyzed: ācārya aupādhyāya tad putreṣu tri rātram
translated: (The penance is) three nights in the case of the teacher, the preceptor, and their sons.

analyzed: ṛtvijām ca

analyzed: śiṣya sa tīrthya sabrahmacāriṣu tri rātram ahar rātram eka aham iti kurvīta
translated: (The penance is) three nights, one night and a day, or one day, in the case of disciples, fellow students, and fellow religious students.

analyzed: garbhasrāve garbha māsa saṃmitāḥ rātrayaḥ strīṇām
translated: In the case of a miscarriage, the nights are equal to the months of pregnancy for women.

analyzed: para śava aupasparśane an abhisaṃdhi pūrvam sa cela sa paḥ spṛṣṭvā sadyas śuddhaḥ bhavati
translated: In the case of touching the dead body of another, if it is unintentional, he becomes pure immediately by touching water along with his clothes.

analyzed: abhisaṃdhi pūrvam tri rātram
translated: If it is intentional, (the penance is) three nights.

analyzed: ṛtumatyām ca

analyzed: veda vikrayiṇam yūpam patitam citim eva ca
translated: One who sells the Veda, the sacrificial post, a fallen person, and the sacrificial altar,

analyzed: spṛṣṭvā samācaret snānam caṇḍālam eva ca

analyzed: brāhmaṇasya vraṇa dvāre pūya śoṇita saṃbhave
translated: If pus and blood arise in the wound of a Brahmana,

analyzed: kṛmiḥ utpadyate tatra prāyaścittam katham bhavet

analyzed: go mūtram gomayam kṣīram dadhi sarpiḥ kuśa odakam
translated: Cow's urine, cow dung, milk, curd, ghee, and water with Kusha grass,

analyzed: tri aham snātvā ca pītvā ca kṛmi daṣṭaḥ śuciḥ bhavet
translated: having bathed and drunk for three days, one bitten by a worm becomes pure.

analyzed: śunā upahataḥ
translated: He who is bitten by a dog should enter water up to his waist.

analyzed: prakṣālya vā tam deśam agninā saṃspṛśya punar prakṣālya pādau ca ācamya prayataḥ bhavati

analyzed: atha api udāharanti
translated: Now they also quote:

analyzed: śunā daṣṭaḥ tu yaḥ vipraḥ nadīm gatvā samudra gām
translated: But a Brahmin who is bitten by a dog, having gone to a river flowing to the ocean,

analyzed: suvarṇa rajatābhyām vā gavām śṛṅga audakena vā

translated: Birds: partridge, pigeon, quail, vulture, peacock, elephant, and boar are the five types of birds.🔽Fish: Sahasradamshtra, chilchima, varmi, brihacchira, mashkari, rohita, and rajivaka.

analyzed: anirdaśa aha saṃdhinī kṣīram a peyam
translated: The milk of a cow within ten days of calving and a cow in heat should not be drunk.

analyzed: vivatsa anyavatsayoḥ ca  āvikam auṣṭrikam aikaśapham apeyam
translated: And of a cow without a calf and a cow with a calf of another cow.🔽The milk of a sheep, camel, and one-hoofed animal should not be drunk.

analyzed: a peya payaḥ pāne kṛcchraḥ anyatra gavyāt
translated: In drinking the milk of an animal whose milk should not be drunk, one should perform a Krichchhra, except in the case of cow's milk.

analyzed: gavye tu tri rātram upavāsaḥ
translated: But in the case of cow's milk, one should fast for three nights.
Except for stale vegetables, meat, ghee, cooked rice, jaggery, curd, honey, flour, and cakes.

analyzed: śuktāni tathā jātaḥ guḍaḥ
translated: And similarly, jaggery made from sugarcane.

original: śrāvaṇyāṃ paurṇamāsyām āṣāḍhyāṃ vāupākṛtya taiṣyāṃmāghyāṃ vāutsṛjeyuḥ / utsṛjeyuḥ //
analyzed: śrāvaṇyām paurṇamāsyām āṣāḍhyām vā upākṛtya taiṣyām māghyām vā utsṛjeyuḥ utsṛjeyuḥ

analyzed: śucim adhvaram devāḥ juṣante

analyzed: śuci kāmāḥ hi devāḥ śucayaḥ ca

analyzed: tat īśā abhivadati om

analyzed: ṛtena satyam ṛtasāpaḥ āyan śuci janmānaḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ iti ṛc

analyzed: ahatam vāsasām śuci

analyzed: evam prakramāt ūrdhvam

analyzed: dīrghasomeṣu sattreṣu ca evam

analyzed: yathā samāmnātam ca

analyzed: yathā etat abhicaraṇīyeṣu iṣṭi paśu someṣu lohita oṣṇīṣa a lohita vāsasaḥ ca ṛtvijaḥ pracareyuḥ citra vāsasaḥ citra āsaṅgau ṛṣākapau

analyzed: iti ca
translated: And thus.

analyzed: agnyādhāne kṣaumāṇi vāsāṃsi teṣām alābhe kārpāsikāni aurṇāni vā bhavanti

analyzed: klinnāyāḥ medhyam āhṛtya pracchādanam
translated: For a wet ground, one should cover it with clean earth.

analyzed: evam kṣudra samidhām

analyzed: ucchiṣṭa lepa aupahatānām avatakṣaṇam

analyzed: mūtra purīṣa lohita retaḥ prabhṛti upahatānām utsargaḥ

analyzed: tat etat anyatra nirdeśāt

analyzed: yathā etat agnihotre gharmocchiṣṭe ca dadhigharme ca kuṇḍapāyinām ayane ca autsargiṇām ayane ca dākṣāyaṇayajñe ca eḍādadhe ca iḍādadhe

translated: For those defiled by urine, feces, blood, semen, etc., there is the act of discarding.🔽For earthen vessels that have come into contact with remnants, there is the act of scraping.

analyzed: mūtra purīṣa lohita retaḥ prabhṛti upahatānām utsargaḥ

analyzed: tvam agne vrata pāḥ asi iti prabuddhaḥ
translated: When waking up, (he murmurs), You, O Agni, are the guardian of vows.

analyzed: strī śūdraiḥ na abhibhāṣeta mūtra purīṣe na avekṣeta
translated: He should not converse with women and Shudras, nor should he look at urine and excrement.

analyzed: amedhyam dṛṣṭvā japati
translated: Having seen impure things, he murmurs (the following verse):🔽The sun is the highest place of Viṣṇu, the highest abode. Having reached that place, may he not return from there.

original: abaddhaṃ mano daridraṃ cakṣuḥ sūryojyotiṣāṃ śreṣṭho dīkṣe mā mā hāsīr iti //
analyzed: a baddham manaḥ daridram cakṣuḥ sūryaḥ jyotiṣām śreṣṭhaḥ dīkṣe mā mā hāsīḥ iti
translated: The mind is unfettered, the eye is poor, the sun is the best of lights, do not abandon me in the consecration.

analyzed: adds atha yadi enam abhivarṣati undatīḥ balam dhatta iti

analyzed: prathamāyām aparapakṣasya caturdaśa grāsān

analyzed: evam eka apacayena ā amāvāsyāyāḥ
translated: In the same way, by decreasing one by one, up to the new moon.

analyzed: amāvāsyāyām grāsaḥ na vidyate
translated: On the new moon day, there is no mouthful.

original: atha K omits atha prathamāyāṃ pūrva /pakṣasyaekaḥ /🔽dvaudvitīyāyām K /

analyzed: dvitīyasyām

analyzed: evam eka aupacayena ā paurṇamāsyāḥ

original: purastātśroṇāyā abhijitaḥ sa /daivatasya hutvā gāṃbrāhmaṇebhyo dadyāt //🔽tad etac cāndrāyaṇaṃ pipīlikā /madhyam /
analyzed: purastāt śroṇāyāḥ abhijitaḥ sa daivatasya hutvā gām brāhmaṇebhyaḥ dadyāt  tat etat cāndrāyaṇam pipīlikāmadhyam
translated: Having offered to Abhijit with its deity before the Srona, he should give a cow to the Brahmins.🔽This is the lunar penance with ants in the middle.

analyzed: viparītam yavamadhyam
translated: The opposite one with barley in the middle.

analyzed: atas anyatarat caritvā sarvebhyaḥ pātakebhyaḥ pāpa kṛt śuddhaḥ bhavati
translated: Having performed either of these, a sinner becomes pure from all mortal sins.

analyzed: kāmāya kāmāya etat āhāryam iti ācakṣate
translated: They say this should be performed for every desire.

analyzed: yam kāmam kāmayate tam etena āpnoti
translated: By this one obtains whatever desire one may have.

original: etena vā ṛṣaya ātmānaṃ śodhayitvā purā karmāṇy asādhayan/
analyzed: etena vai ṛṣayaḥ ātmānam śodhayitvā purā karmāṇi asādhayan
translated: By this, the sages, having purified themselves, accomplished their deeds in the past.

analyzed: tat etat dhanyam puṇyam putryam pautryam paśavyam āyuṣyam svargyam yaśasyam sārvakāmikam
translated: This is blessed, meritorious, conducive to sons, grandsons, cattle, long life, heaven, fame, and fulfills all desires.

analyzed: nakṣatrāṇām dyutim sūryācandramasoḥ eva k omits eva sāyujyam salokatām āpnoti yaḥ u ca enat adhīte
translated: One who studies this attains the radiance of the stars, the splendor of the sun and moon, and union and the same world as those who have attained this.

analyzed: yaḥ u ca enat adhīte
translated: And one who studies this.

analyzed: atha atas an aśnat pārāyaṇa vidhim vyākhyāsyāmaḥ

analyzed: śuci vāsāḥ syāt cīra vāsāḥ vā

analyzed: haviṣyam annam icchet apaḥ phalāni vā
translated: One should desire food fit for sacrifice, water, or fruits.

analyzed: grāmāt prācīm vā audīcīm vā diśam upaniṣkramya gomayena gocarma mātram

analyzed: agnaye svāhā

analyzed: prajāpataye svāhā

analyzed: somāyasvāhā k
translated: To Soma, svāhā.

analyzed: somāya svāhā prajāpataye svāhā viśvebhyaḥ devebhyaḥ svayaṃbhuve ṛgbhyaḥ yajurbhyaḥ
translated: To Soma, Svâhâ! To Prajâpati, Svâhâ! To the All-gods, self-existent, to the Rik, Yagus,

analyzed: apratibhāyām yāvatā kālena na veda tāvantam kālam tat adhīyīta sa yadā jānīyāt kim

analyzed: dvādaśa veda saṃhitāḥ adhīyīta

analyzed: atas ūrdhvam saṃcayaḥ

analyzed: aparāḥ dvādaśa veda saṃhitāḥ adhītya tābhiḥ prajāpateḥ lokam avāpnoti

analyzed: an aśnan saṃhitā sahasram adhīyīta  brahma bhūtaḥ virajaḥ k

analyzed: virājaḥ brahma bhavati

translated: Eating barley for six months, eating barley and water for four months,

analyzed: devaniśśrayaṇī iti ācakṣate

analyzed: aśnāti a caraṇīyena vā carati
translated: or he behaves in what should not be behaved in.

analyzed: nahi karma kṣīyate iti  kuryāt iti k
translated: For the act is not destroyed, they say.

analyzed: kuryāt tu eva  punastomena eṣṭvā k
translated: One should perform (the expiation), they say.🔽But one should perform (the expiation) indeed.🔽Having performed the Puna-stoma, one should perform (the expiation), they say.

analyzed: punastomena yajeta punar savanam āyānti iti k
translated: One should sacrifice with the Puna-stoma, they say. They come again to the Savana, they say.

analyzed: āyanti iti vijñāyate
translated: It is known that they come.

analyzed: atha api udāharanti
translated: Now they also quote:

translated: He who performs the horse sacrifice overcomes all evil, he overcomes even the sin of Brahman-slaying.

analyzed: agniṣṭutā vā a abhiśaṃsyamānaḥ u k
translated: Or one who is being slandered should perform the Agnishtoma sacrifice.

analyzed: vā abhiśasyamānaḥ yajeta eti ca
translated: And one who is being accused should perform the sacrifice.

original: tasya niṣkrayaṇāni japas tapo homa upavāso dānam //
analyzed: tasya niṣkrayaṇāni japaḥ tapaḥ homaḥ upavāsaḥ dānam
translated: The expiations for that are: muttering, austerity, oblation, fasting, and giving gifts.

analyzed: upaniṣadaḥ veda ādayaḥ vedāntāḥ sarva chandaḥsu saṃhitāḥ madhūni aghamarṣaṇam
translated: The Upaniṣads, the Vedas, the Vedānta texts, all the meters, the Saṃhitās, the Madhu, the Aghamarṣaṇa

analyzed: atharvaśiraḥ rudrāḥ puruṣasūktam rājana rauhiṇe sāmanī bṛhat rathaṃtare puruṣa gatiḥ

original: mahānāmnyo mahāvairājaṃ mahādivākīrtyaṃjyeṣṭha /sāmnām anyatamaṃ bahiṣpavamānaḥ K /
analyzed: mahānāmnyaḥ mahāvairājam mahādivākīrtyam jyeṣṭhasāmnām anyatamam bahiṣpavamānaḥ k

translated: the Bahispavamāna, the Kūṣmāṇḍa, the Pāvamānī, and the Sāvitrī [hymns] - these are the purifying [texts].

original: upasan /nyāyena payovratatā śākabhakṣatā phalabhakṣatāmūlabhakṣatā prasṛti /yāvako hiraṇya /prāśanaṃ ghṛta /prāśanaṃsoma /pānam iti
analyzed: upasad nyāyena payaḥ vrata tā śāka bhakṣa tā phala bhakṣa tā mūla bhakṣa tā prasṛti yāvakaḥ hiraṇya prāśanam ghṛta prāśanam soma pānam iti

translated: All mountains, all rivers, all holy streams, lakes, sacred places, the abodes of sages, cowpens, fields, and boundaries are places (where penances are to be performed).

original: ahiṃsā satyam astainyaṃ savaneṣuudaka /upasparśanaṃguru /śuśrūṣā brahmacaryam adhaḥ /śayanam ekavastratāanāśaka ititapāṃsi //

analyzed: hiraṇyam gauḥ vāsaḥ aśvaḥ bhūmiḥ tilāḥ ghṛtam annam iti deyāni
translated: Gold, cows, clothes, horses, land, sesame seeds, ghee, and food are things to be given.

translated: These (penances) should be performed in the absence of specific injunctions.

analyzed: enaḥsu guruṣu gurūṇi laghuṣu laghūni

translated: The penances for all (sins) are (thus).

analyzed: prāyaścittāni vakṣyāmaḥ nānā arthāni pṛthak pṛthak
translated: We shall now describe the various penances separately.

original: teṣu /teṣu ca doṣeṣu garīyāṃsi laghūni ca //
analyzed: teṣu teṣu ca doṣeṣu garīyāṃsi laghūni ca
translated: Among those (sins), some are heavy and some are light.

translated: For if it were proper here, he should have indicated it there itself.

analyzed: bhūyaḥ bhūyaḥ garīyaḥsu laghuṣu alpīyasaḥ tathā

analyzed: vidhinā śāstra dṛṣṭena prāṇaāyāmān samācaret
translated: one should practice the breath-control according to the method seen in the scriptures.

original: yad upastha /kṛtaṃ pāpaṃ padbhyāṃ vā yat kṛtaṃ bhavet /
